name: PeakForm Physio
description: Your digital companion for physiotherapy care, exercise plans, and clinic updates

clinic.name: PeakForm Physio
clinic.description: Independent Physiotherapy & Sports Rehab Clinic serving the local community with personalized care and evidence-based treatment.
clinic.parking: Free parking available in front of the clinic and in the adjacent lot.
clinic.accessibility: Wheelchair accessible with ramp entrance and accessible washrooms.

staff.name: Dr. Sarah Chen
staff.title: Lead Physiotherapist & Clinic Director
staff.bio: With over 12 years of experience, Dr. Chen specializes in helping athletes and active individuals return to peak performance. She holds advanced certifications in manual therapy and sports rehabilitation.
staff.education: MSc Physiotherapy, University of British Columbia

staff.name: Mike Rodriguez
staff.title: Senior Physiotherapist
staff.bio: Mike brings 8 years of clinical experience with a focus on evidence-based treatment approaches. He's passionate about helping patients understand their conditions and take an active role in their recovery.

staff.name: Lisa Patel
staff.title: Physiotherapist & Wellness Coordinator
staff.bio: Lisa specializes in women's health physiotherapy and has extensive training in pelvic floor rehabilitation. She's dedicated to providing compassionate, personalized care for women at all stages of life.

categories.name: Lower Back
categories.description: Exercises for lower back pain relief and strengthening

categories.name: Flexibility & Stretching
categories.description: Improve range of motion and flexibility

exercises.title: Cat-Cow Stretch
exercises.description: Gentle spinal mobility exercise to warm up the back and improve flexibility.
instructions: Start on hands and knees in tabletop position
Arch your back and look up (Cow pose)
Round your spine and tuck your chin (Cat pose)
exercises.tips: Keep movements slow and controlled. Focus on feeling the stretch along your entire spine.

exercises.title: Wall Sit
exercises.description: Isometric exercise to strengthen quadriceps and glutes, commonly used in ACL rehabilitation.
instructions: Stand with your back against a wall
Slide down until your knees are at 90 degrees
Keep your back flat against the wall
Slowly slide back up to standing
exercises.tips: Start with shorter holds and gradually increase duration. Keep your knees aligned over your ankles.

exercises.title: Shoulder Blade Squeeze
exercises.description: Strengthens the muscles between your shoulder blades to improve posture and reduce shoulder pain.
instructions: Sit or stand with good posture
exercises.tips: Imagine you're trying to hold a pencil between your shoulder blades. Keep your shoulders relaxed.

rehabPlans.title: ACL Recovery - Phase 1 (Weeks 1-4)
rehabPlans.description: Early rehabilitation exercises for post-ACL surgery recovery
rehabPlans.instructions: Perform these exercises 2-3 times daily. Stop if you experience sharp pain.

wellnessTips.title: Winter Posture Tips
wellnessTips.excerpt: Maintain good posture during winter months to prevent back and neck pain.
wellnessTips.content: Winter weather can lead to poor posture habits. Here are some tips to maintain spinal health during the colder months...
wellnessTips.author: Dr. Sarah Chen

wellnessTips.title: Marathon Training Recovery
wellnessTips.excerpt: Essential recovery strategies for marathon runners to prevent injury and optimize performance.
wellnessTips.content: Training for a marathon requires careful attention to recovery. Here's how to keep your body strong and injury-free...
wellnessTips.author: Mike Rodriguez

wellnessTips.title: Hydration for Recovery
wellnessTips.excerpt: Proper hydration plays a crucial role in tissue healing and recovery from injury.
wellnessTips.content: Water is essential for every bodily function, including tissue repair and recovery. Learn how to optimize your hydration...
wellnessTips.author: Lisa Patel
